leave_policy.title: Employee Leave Policy
leave_policy.content: Manila Water employees are entitled to 15 days of vacation leave annually (earned monthly at 1.25 days). Sick leave is provided up to 12 days per year with medical certificate required for absences exceeding 3 consecutive days. Emergency leave may be granted for unforeseen circumstances with manager approval. Maternity leave: 105 days for female employees (60 days with pay + 45 days without pay). Paternity leave: 7 days for male employees with full pay. Bereavement leave: 3 days for immediate family (spouse, children, parents), 1 day for relatives. Study leave available for work-related education with prior approval. Solo parent leave: 7 days annually. VAWC leave: 10 days for victims of violence against women and children. Service incentive leave (SIL): 5 days minimum as per Labor Code. Field personnel emergency leave for weather disturbances and natural disasters.

health_benefits.title: Health and Wellness Benefits
health_benefits.content: MWCI provides comprehensive health insurance through Maxicare/Intellicare including medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and up to 3 dependents. Annual health check-ups are mandatory and fully covered at accredited clinics. Mental health support and wellness programs available through employee assistance program. Coverage includes outpatient care (PHP 150,000), inpatient care (PHP 500,000), emergency care (no limit), prescription drugs (PHP 15,000), specialist consultations, laboratory tests, and diagnostic procedures. Dental coverage up to PHP 25,000 annually. Optical benefits PHP 8,000 every 2 years. Free annual physical exam and flu vaccination. Maternity benefits include pre-natal, delivery, and post-natal care. Critical illness coverage up to PHP 100,000. Accident insurance coverage for field personnel.

training_programs.title: Professional Development and Training
training_programs.content: Manila Water invests in continuous learning through technical training, leadership development, and professional certification programs. Each employee has an annual training budget of PHP 50,000-100,000 depending on level. Online learning platforms (Coursera, LinkedIn Learning) and external conference attendance encouraged. Technical certifications for water treatment operators, plumbers, engineers, and IT professionals fully sponsored. Leadership programs available for supervisory roles and above. Safety training mandatory for all field personnel (40-hour OSHA, confined space entry, electrical safety). Professional Engineering (PRC) license support and review programs. Scholarship programs for deserving employees pursuing relevant degrees. Skills-based training for meter reading, pipe laying, water quality testing, and customer service.

remote_work.title: Flexible Work Arrangements
remote_work.content: Hybrid work model allows up to 3 days remote work per week for eligible office positions (IT, Finance, HR, Customer Service). Work-from-home equipment allowance PHP 15,000 and internet allowance PHP 2,500/month. Core hours 10 AM - 3 PM required for collaboration. Compressed work week (4x10 hours) available for certain departments with manager approval. Flexible start times between 6:30 AM - 9 AM. Field operations personnel (meter readers, technicians, plumbers) maintain regular field schedules. Emergency response teams on 24/7 rotational basis. Weather work suspension follows DOLE guidelines during typhoons and severe weather.

performance_review.title: Performance Management System
performance_review.content: Annual performance reviews conducted in Q1 (January-March) with mid-year check-ins in July. Goal setting aligned with company objectives using OKR framework and balanced scorecard approach. Performance ratings: Outstanding (5%, 8-10% merit increase), Exceeds Expectations (20%, 5-7% merit increase), Meets Expectations (70%, 3-4% merit increase), Below Expectations (5%, performance improvement plan). 360-degree feedback for leadership positions. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) include water quality compliance, customer satisfaction scores, non-revenue water reduction, safety incidents, and operational efficiency metrics. Field personnel evaluated on service completion rates, safety compliance, and customer feedback scores.

compensation_benefits.title: Compensation and Benefits Structure
compensation_benefits.content: MWCI follows market-competitive salary structure with annual benchmarking against utility companies and conglomerates. Salary paid twice monthly (15th and 30th) with early release 2-3 days ahead. 13th month pay guaranteed plus performance bonus up to 2-4 months salary based on company and individual performance. Rice allowance: PHP 2,000/month. Transportation allowance: PHP 3,500/month for non-company vehicle users. Meal/food allowance: PHP 200/day (PHP 4,400/month). Phone allowance: PHP 2,500/month for eligible positions. Uniform allowance: PHP 8,000 annually. Safety shoe allowance: PHP 3,000 annually for field personnel. Night shift differential: 10% for work between 10 PM - 6 AM. Overtime pay: 125% for first 8 hours, 130% thereafter. Holiday pay: 200% for regular holidays, 130% for special non-working days. Service awards (5, 10, 15, 20, 25+ years). Stock options available for senior management through parent company Ayala Corporation.

field_operations_policy.title: Field Operations and Safety Guidelines
field_operations_policy.content: All field personnel must complete 40-hour safety training before deployment. Personal protective equipment mandatory: hard hat, safety shoes, reflective vest, safety goggles, and gloves. Confined space entry procedures with permits and atmospheric testing. Excavation safety protocols with proper shoring and signage. Traffic management plans required for road works. Emergency response procedures for water main breaks, service interruptions, and customer complaints. Vehicle safety inspections and defensive driving certification. Hazmat handling for water treatment chemicals. Lock-out/Tag-out procedures for equipment maintenance. Heat stress prevention during summer months. Typhoon and flood response protocols. 24/7 emergency hotline for field personnel. GPS tracking for service vehicles and lone worker safety. Daily safety briefings and incident reporting within 24 hours.

customer_service_standards.title: Customer Service Excellence Framework
customer_service_standards.content: Customer service representatives must maintain 95% customer satisfaction rating. Response time standards: phone calls within 3 rings, walk-in customers within 5 minutes, email within 24 hours. Service connection completion within 5 working days for standard connections. Complaint resolution within 48 hours for service issues, 5 days for billing concerns. Meter reading accuracy of 99.5% with photo documentation. Multiple payment channels: cash, check, online banking, GCash, PayMaya, over-the-counter partners (7-Eleven, Cebuana, SM Bills Payment). Multilingual support (English, Filipino, and local dialects). Customer satisfaction surveys and mystery shopper programs. Service recovery protocols for major service interruptions. Community relations programs and public consultations for infrastructure projects.

water_quality_compliance.title: Water Quality and Regulatory Compliance
water_quality_compliance.content: Strict adherence to Philippine National Standards for Drinking Water (PNSDW) and Department of Health regulations. Daily water quality testing at source, treatment plants, and distribution network. Laboratory certification and accreditation maintenance. Monthly reporting to Local Water Utilities Administration (LWUA) and Department of Health. Employee certification programs for water treatment plant operators and quality control technicians. Contamination response protocols and public notification procedures. Cross-connection control programs and backflow prevention. Sanitary surveys and watershed protection activities. Customer water quality complaint investigation within 24 hours. Regular audit and inspection compliance with regulatory agencies.

code_of_conduct.title: Employee Code of Conduct and Ethics
code_of_conduct.content: All employees must maintain highest standards of integrity and professionalism aligned with Ayala Group values. Zero tolerance for harassment, discrimination, corruption, or unethical behavior. Confidentiality agreements must be observed for customer data and business information. Conflict of interest must be disclosed including business relationships with suppliers or contractors. Gift policy: no gifts exceeding PHP 1,000 from customers, suppliers, or stakeholders. Social media guidelines prohibiting posting of confidential company information. Whistleblower protection guaranteed with anonymous reporting channels. Anti-corruption policy aligned with Ayala Integrity Initiative. Environmental stewardship and sustainability practices. Community engagement and corporate social responsibility participation. Violations subject to disciplinary action up to termination and potential legal action.

safety_security.title: Workplace Safety and Security
safety_security.content: Comprehensive safety management system with OSHAS 18001 certification. Mandatory safety training for all employees with annual refresher courses. Personal protective equipment provided at no cost with quarterly replacement schedule. Safety incidents must be reported within 24 hours using incident report system. Emergency evacuation procedures posted in all facilities with quarterly drills. Fire safety system maintenance and inspection. Security access cards with biometric system for all premises. CCTV monitoring in all facilities and vehicle GPS tracking. Visitor management system with escort requirements. COVID-19 protocols including health screening, sanitation, and contact tracing. Occupational health programs including annual medical exams. Safety committee with employee representatives. Zero accident target with safety performance indicators.

disciplinary_procedures.title: Progressive Disciplinary Action Policy
disciplinary_procedures.content: Progressive discipline follows Labor Code requirements: Verbal counseling → Written warning → Final written warning → Suspension (1-30 days) → Termination. Due process guaranteed with two-notice rule and hearing opportunity. Employee right to union representation or chosen representative. Serious offenses (theft, fraud, insubordination, safety violations) may result in immediate suspension pending investigation. Appeal process available through HR committee and grievance machinery. Documentation required at each step with employee acknowledgment. Improvement plans implemented with specific timelines and monitoring. Offenses categorized as: administrative (tardiness, dress code), performance (failure to meet KPIs), disciplinary (insubordination, misconduct), and criminal (theft, violence). Positive discipline program emphasizing coaching and development.

recruitment_hiring.title: Recruitment and Hiring Procedures
recruitment_hiring.content: Equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion with special consideration for PWDs and indigenous peoples. All positions posted internally first for 5 working days through job portal. Competency-based selection process with structured interviews and skills assessment. Background checks required for all hires including NBI clearance and previous employment verification. Reference verification mandatory with at least 2 professional references. Pre-employment medical examination including drug testing at accredited clinics. Psychological assessment for supervisory and safety-critical positions. 90-day probationary period for new hires with performance evaluation at 30, 60, and 90 days. Employee referral program with PHP 10,000-15,000 bonus for successful placements depending on position level. Graduate trainee programs for fresh engineering and business graduates with 2-year development track.

data_privacy.title: Data Privacy and Information Security
data_privacy.content: Full compliance with Data Privacy Act of 2012 (RA 10173) and National Privacy Commission regulations. Customer data protection with encryption and access controls. Personal data collection limited to business necessity with explicit consent. Employee privacy rights with controlled access to personnel records. Regular cybersecurity awareness training mandatory with phishing simulation tests. Password policy requires 8+ characters with complexity and 90-day expiration. Multi-factor authentication for critical systems. VPN required for remote access with endpoint security. USB restrictions and device encryption policies. Data breach response plan activated within 72 hours with NPC notification. Regular penetration testing and vulnerability assessments. Information classification system (public, internal, confidential, restricted). Document retention and disposal policies with secure destruction procedures.

environmental_sustainability.title: Environmental Management and Sustainability
environmental_sustainability.content: ISO 14001 environmental management system implementation. Water conservation programs and non-revenue water reduction initiatives. Waste segregation and recycling programs in all facilities. Carbon footprint reduction through energy efficiency and renewable energy adoption. Sludge management and proper disposal from water treatment plants. Chemical storage and handling procedures with MSDS compliance. Environmental monitoring and compliance with DENR regulations. Tree planting and watershed protection activities. Green building certification for new facilities. Sustainable procurement policies prioritizing eco-friendly suppliers. Employee environmental awareness programs. Community education on water conservation and environmental protection.

retirement_separation.title: Retirement and Separation Benefits
retirement_separation.content: Optional retirement at 60, mandatory at 65 years old as per Labor Code. Retirement benefit calculation: 22.5 days per year of service for first 10 years, 1 month for years 11-20, 1.5 months for 21+ years, or SSS retirement benefit whichever is higher. Resignation requires 30-day notice with proper turnover. Separation pay computation as per Labor Code Article 298. Exit interview mandatory with HR and immediate supervisor. Return of company property checklist including ID, laptop, tools, and uniforms. Final pay release within 30 days including unused leave conversion. COBRA-style health insurance continuation for 6 months at employee cost. Retiree association membership and company events invitation. Service awards and recognition ceremony. Career transition and financial planning seminars for retiring employees. Alumni network participation in company activities.

union_relations.title: Labor Relations and Union Partnership
union_relations.content: Recognition of Manila Water Employees Union (MWEU) as exclusive bargaining agent. Collective Bargaining Agreement (CBA) negotiations every 3 years. Labor-Management Committee meetings monthly for workplace concerns. Grievance machinery with multiple levels including union representation. Freedom of association and right to organize protected. Union dues check-off system with employee authorization. No strike, no lockout clause during CBA effectivity. Joint safety committee with union representatives. Productivity improvement programs with gainsharing mechanisms. Dispute resolution through conciliation and arbitration. Union activities allowed during break times and designated areas. Labor education and training programs for union officers.

onboarding_faq.question: What documents do I need for my first day?
onboarding_faq.answer: Please bring: (1) Valid government-issued ID (driver's license, passport, PRC license), (2) TIN number and BIR Certificate, (3) SSS/PhilHealth/Pag-IBIG member's data sheet and ID copies, (4) Medical certificate from DOH-accredited clinic with drug test results, (5) NBI clearance (not older than 6 months), (6) Diploma and transcript of records, (7) Certificate of employment from previous employer, (8) 2x2 ID photos (6 pieces with white background), (9) Birth certificate (NSO/PSA copy), (10) Marriage certificate if applicable, and (11) Barangay clearance. HR will provide a detailed checklist via email 3 days before your start date with specific requirements for your position.

onboarding_faq.question: How do I access company systems on my first day?
onboarding_faq.answer: IT will set up your accounts during the comprehensive IT orientation on Day 1 from 2:00-4:00 PM. You'll receive temporary passwords for: corporate email (@manilawater.com), HRIS system for payroll and benefits, SAP for finance and procurement, Microsoft Teams for communication, SharePoint for documents, and job-specific systems (billing system for customer service, work order system for field operations, etc.). Initial passwords must be changed within 24 hours. You'll also get VPN access for remote work and mobile device setup if applicable to your role.

onboarding_faq.question: When will I receive my company ID, equipment, and uniform?
onboarding_faq.answer: Company ID will be issued after photo session during HR processing on Day 1, ready by 3:00 PM. Laptop and basic equipment provided during IT setup by end of Day 1. Uniform measurements taken during first week with delivery within 2 weeks (2 sets of company polo shirts, 1 jacket, and field uniform if applicable). Safety equipment (hard hat, safety shoes, reflective vest) issued immediately for field positions based on job requirements. Mobile phone issued within 3 days for positions requiring field mobility. Service vehicle assignment within first week for technicians and field supervisors.

onboarding_faq.question: What is the dress code for different positions?
onboarding_faq.answer: Office personnel: Business casual (collared shirts, slacks/skirts, closed shoes, no flip-flops or shorts). Company polo shirts provided quarterly. Field operations: Uniform shirts with company logo, dark pants, safety shoes (steel-toed), and required PPE. Engineering staff: Business casual with safety gear when visiting sites. Customer service: Business casual with neat grooming standards. Management: Business attire (coat and tie for formal meetings). Fridays are casual dress days (jeans allowed, no shorts or slippers). Special events may require formal attire. Grooming standards include clean appearance and proper hygiene.

onboarding_faq.question: How do I enroll in benefits and what's covered?
onboarding_faq.answer: Benefits enrollment completed during HR orientation Day 2 using the online portal with HR assistance. Healthcare coverage (Maxicare/Intellicare) begins Day 1 with premium deductions starting Month 2. Coverage includes medical (PHP 150K outpatient, PHP 500K inpatient), dental (PHP 25K), optical (PHP 8K every 2 years), and dependents coverage (spouse + 3 children). Government benefits (SSS, PhilHealth, Pag-IBIG) enrollment mandatory. Life insurance (2x annual salary) automatic. Choose beneficiaries for all benefits. You have 30 days to make changes or add dependents. Benefits orientation session explains all coverage details and claims procedures.

onboarding_faq.question: What is my work schedule and reporting structure?
onboarding_faq.answer: Standard office hours: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM Monday-Friday with 1-hour lunch (12:00-1:00 PM). Flexible start time 7:00-9:00 AM with manager approval. Field operations may have varying schedules including weekend rotations. Emergency response teams on 24/7 standby rotation. Core collaboration hours 10:00 AM - 3:00 PM for remote workers. Overtime requires supervisor approval. Your immediate supervisor will be introduced on Day 1 along with team structure, department head, and reporting relationships. Regular team meetings scheduled weekly, monthly one-on-ones with supervisor, and quarterly department meetings.

onboarding_faq.question: Where do I park and how do I access the building?
onboarding_faq.answer: Security will assign parking slot and provide temporary pass for first week. Monthly parking fee PHP 800 (air-conditioned basement) or PHP 500 (open parking) deducted from payroll. Motorcycle parking PHP 200/month. Building access card activated after security briefing and photo submission. Biometric enrollment for fingerprint access. Main entrance open 6:00 AM - 8:00 PM, after-hours access through security. Visitor registration required at main lobby. Emergency exits and evacuation routes explained during safety orientation. Car pool and shuttle service information available from HR.

onboarding_faq.question: What safety training and equipment will I receive?
onboarding_faq.answer: All employees undergo basic safety orientation on Day 1 covering emergency procedures, fire safety, and general workplace hazards. Field personnel complete 40-hour safety training within first month including confined space entry, electrical safety, and hazmat handling. Safety equipment issued based on job requirements: hard hat, safety glasses, steel-toed shoes, reflective vest, gloves, and specialized gear for specific tasks. Annual safety refresher training mandatory. Safety manual provided and safety officer contact information shared. Incident reporting procedures explained with 24-hour reporting requirement.

onboarding_faq.question: How do I set up payroll and what allowances will I receive?
onboarding_faq.answer: Bring bank account details (account number, bank certificate or passbook copy) to HR during first week. Payroll setup in SAP system with direct deposit to your chosen bank. Salary paid twice monthly (15th and 30th) with early release 2-3 days ahead. First pay includes pro-rated basic salary plus allowances: rice (PHP 2,000), transportation (PHP 3,500), meal (PHP 4,400), and phone allowance (PHP 2,500 if applicable). Government deductions (SSS, PhilHealth, Pag-IBIG, withholding tax) and health insurance premiums start Month 2. Multiple bank accounts can be set up for salary splitting if needed.

onboarding_faq.question: What training programs and career development opportunities are available?
onboarding_faq.answer: New hire orientation program spans 2 weeks covering company history, mission/vision, policies, systems training, and department-specific training. Technical training budget PHP 50,000-100,000 annually based on position level. Online learning platforms (Coursera, LinkedIn Learning) access provided. Professional certification support for relevant licenses (PRC engineering, water treatment operator, safety officer). Leadership development programs for supervisory track. Conference and seminar attendance encouraged with advance approval. Graduate degree scholarship programs for deserving employees. Mentorship program pairs new hires with experienced employees. Career planning sessions with HR annually.
